meanings.definition: Incapable of going wrong or being misused.
meanings.sent1: Following the simple instructions makes the process foolproof.
meanings.sent2: The foolproof lock ensured the door stayed securely closed.
meanings.sent3: Even a monkey could use this foolproof device!
meanings.sent4: Her foolproof plan to ace the test involved color-coding her notes.
meanings.sent5: The foolproof method of baking cookies left no room for error.

meanings.definition: Designed to be completely reliable and safe to use.
meanings.sent1: The foolproof design of the car included multiple airbags.
meanings.sent2: The foolproof software prevented any data loss.
meanings.sent3: The foolproof umbrella kept him dry even in a storm.
meanings.sent4: Her foolproof strategy for packing a suitcase saved her time and space.
meanings.sent5: The foolproof seatbelt ensured his safety during the crash.
